text:
UPDATED: JUN 15, 2017 330 ml can from Mikkeller Beer Club, bb 06/12/17 ?
Amber-copper moderate hazy body, with a medium, fluffy, lacing, yellowish head. 
Lovely, very fresh aroma of elderflowers, white wine, grapes, citrus, flowers, fresh herbs, some wood. 
Tastes quite similar, with the wine barrel notes more dominant, more spices, quite some alcohol. 
Medium, a bit oily mouthfeel, with an average carbonation. 
Finishes spicy, a bit boozy, wooden, a bit bitter, vinous, floral, medium fruity, a bit hoppy. 

Tasty. The nose is wonderful, very fresh and diverse, releasing more and more aromas. The taste doesnt keep up though, feels a bit harsh, maybe too fresh. Overall still a very interesting, complex beer.
Ar/Ap/T/P/Ov: 9/4/7/4/16

0,33l can at home shared by Saeglopur, big thanks. BB 06/12/2017. As Mikkeller Nelson Sauvin Brut (front label). back states: Aged in Chardonnay barrels. dark yellow clear color, small white head. smells flowery, light sweetness, bit peppery, belgian yeast, some exotic fruits, spices, light berry notes, some herbs, light dill, elder flowers, hints of rosemary. very nice smell. full body, soft carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes exotic fruits, some funk, citric, some wood, earthy, belgian yeast, bit peppery, some herbs, light dill, thyme, very light elder flowers, light sweetness. finishes lightly sweet and lightly bitter with notes of belgian yeast, herbs, grass and hints of sweetness. very nice one, good to drink, not totally convinced by the flavor balance (especially on the taste), also just a tad heavy, but overall very nice one.

UPDATED: JUN 13, 2017 Sharer. A real class act. Getting a lot of chardonnay, thyme, grass. Aging in white wine barrels was a master stroke I hope see emulated in the future. Complex and dry with medium head, relatively slowly dissipating. Somewhere beneath all that some classic Belgian malt flavorings make for some subtle sweet notes. Powerful grassy farmhouse skunk on the nose.
330 ml can from Mikkeller beer club. Clear golden with white head. Sour fruity with grapes, oak and fruit. Dry and sour with medium bitterness and medium carbonation.

Light, floral, yeasty aroma. Tastes of thyme, lemon, and chardonnay with a darker, tripel-like taste in the background. Head sticks around for a while with tiny, sharp bubbles - decently carbonated for a tripel. Very nice overall.

Refrigerated 75 cl brown bottle poured into a tulip. Clear copper with medium/big off-white head. Aroma is chardonnay, medium body, medium/well carbonation, and some lacing. Taste is chardonnay, wood, and dry finish.

Tap (Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen). Almost clear, dark amber colour, almost no head only delicate ring around the glass. There are belgian yeast notes with sweet vanilla, wine in aroma. The barrel dominates the taste but there is not sweet vanilla, maybe a little bit. But there is a lot of dry, wooden notes, full of fruits and some wine notes. Beer is medium to full body but quite light in feeling, to drink for a long time.

Flaska från SB. Doft av grape, funk, äpplen och päron. Komplex med flera smaklager. Frisk syra med frukt, vitvinsfat, trä med kryddig karaktär, lite anis, funk, chardonnay, torr avslutning med citrusskalsbeska. Maffig, komplext där de olika smakerna funkar riktigt bra ihop. Väldigt gott.

Draught at Warpigs.
Hazy orange colored with notes small white head.
Fruity aroma therapy while wine, hops and citrus.
Fruity flavor of hops and citrus with notes of brett and white wine.
Tart finish.

330ml can from Mikkeller Beer Club. BBE 06/12/17. Pours clear orange with a thick foamy head. Aroma of vinous tropical fruits, hops, hints of wood, grapes, yeast and herbal notes. Taste is vinous, fruity hoppy and refreshing with some juicy grape notes, hints of bretta, yeast, herbal notes, pine and citrus. Finish is smooth, vinous, slightly hoppy and yeasty with some hints of tart bretta, grapes, berries, wood, pine and herbal notes. Pretty good.

Flaska från SB. Provning med ölsällskapet. Klar, guldig med högt vitt skum. Doft av vinfat, päron, äpple, pissoartablett. Något större kropp som drar åt det lite torrare hållet. Brödig, honung, päron, vitvin, grön vindruva, avslutas i snäll beska. Stor och elegant.

Pours clear amber with a fairly large white head. Aromas of funk, farmhouse, hay, green apples, green grapes, oak, bretta, light melon. Taste is complex with oak character and light tropical fruit with farmhouse and funky notes along with some grassy and earthy notes. Mouthfeel is medium bodied and quite smooth with moderate carbonation.
Bottled:Pours deep amber with a thick head. Vinous, sourish aoma with nettles and goose berries. Taste is nettles, goose berries, brett, chardonnay wine and a hint of toffee.
@ Basunen 17-2-18: Halvtorr, på gränsen till söt med tydlig ton av aprikos och fat. Veldig låg syrlighet.

bottle bb 7/3/22. Light amber hazy medium head vinos white geape wood fruity citrus kiwi medium bitterness
Leggero ambrato velato schiuma media discreta persistenza naso vinoso fruttato frutta bisnca legno leggero etilico nota dolciastra poi un discreto amaro uva agrume kiwi

Amber color, medium sized white head. Vinous aromas, grapes, peaches, citrus, gooseberries, sour candy and wood. Earthy taste with vinous flavors, gooseberries, citrus, grapes, champagne and pine needles with a slight bitter finish. Really good.
Flaska från brorsan. 75 cl. Orange kulör. Jordig doft. Druva, äpple och funk. Torr vinös smak med inslag av trä och lite stall. Fruktig eftersmak tydliga drag åt sött vitt vin.

Bottle 
Clear orange, white head
Aroma of grapes, raisins
Taste sweet, bitter, tart. Alcoholic. Sour feel. 
Quite strange but

Bottle from systembolaget. 
Pours amber with a white head. 
Aroma of grapes and hops. 
Sweet, wine, balanced bitterness.

750 ml bottle. Pours a dark hazy amber with moderate head. Aromas of wet toasted malts, applesauce,, and musty grapes. Flavors follow same with graham cracker, a bit of Brett and brighter grapes. OK but way overpriced even for a BA.
750-ml bottle from maxs. lighter (than base beer) hazy honey color, wild, sweeter, grapier.

Bottle. Sweet white grape aroma with a complex, slightly dank hops with vanilla oak that comes in with citrus and strawberry hops. Hazy dark amber under a lacy, off-white, flannel blanket. Dry and vinous flavour with assertive bitterness that has some of the wood in it. Very complex flavour with chardonnay and fruit hops. Medium body, medium high carbonation, crisp but slightly warming.

0.75l bottle thanks to Lore. Hazy orange body with a thick white head. Aroma of caramel, grapes, wood, elderflower and gooseberry with a hint of vinegar. Taste of caramel, toast, grapefruit, gooseberry and lemon zest. Not so bitter but the hop character is very pronounced. Awesome beer.
hazy orange colour, moderate sized off-white head, aroma of marmalade or candied orange peel, caramel earthy-wine cellar notes; taste is the same with resiny and white wine notes; amazing beer

Bottle, 9%. Hazy amber with big off-white head. Aroma is malt, grapes white wine, yeast, brett, funk and caramel. Flavour is malt, caramel, yeast, brett, white wine, grapes, funk, medium sweet, medium bitter, hop, wood, warming and medium dry.

750ml corked bottle pours an orange brown color with a finger and a half of fizzy white head that settles to leave some spotted lacing on the glass. Aroma is perfume with some white wine grapes and some spicy notes. Taste is a fruity and malty sweetness with a spicy hop bitterness finishing with a white wine dryness. Medium bodied with good carbonation that tickles the tongue. Overall, a tasty and well crafted brew that must be sampled.

750ml bottle - thanks martjoobolut
Pleasantly sweet aroma . Harsh saisony taste. Plenty of nettley zingy hops in the aroma. Messy sweet malts, belgian yeast evident. Some booze going here too, winey vapours fill the mouth. One or two sips would have been fine, but finishing the whole 75cl was more than a struggle, it was actually impossible. That was a 20 minute walk home, and I didnt finish it. Heavy and sticky. Finish is liquoricey, bit of saisony grunge, and more alcohol heat. Ugh, rough one in that quantity.

Bottle ( from ujh). Pours amber. Aroma is sweet, fruits, apricots, grapes, malt. Flavor is sweet and bitter, sour, apricots, grapes, malt. Finish is dry-grapefruit-apricots bitter. Overall: very good.
750ml bottle (thanks Mart). Clear dark amber color. Small size, ehite head, stays. Grapefruit, sweet, caramel in aroma. Citrus , woody, grapefruit in taste. Grapefruit in aftertaste. Drinkable brew.

20/VIII/16 - 75cl bottle @ Gents Bierfestival - BB: n/a (2016-891) 
Clear orange beer, creamy solid yellowish head, very creamy, stable, bit adhesive. Aroma: very fruity, lots of tropical fruits, bit cheesy, lychee, some smelly feet. MF: ok carbon, medium body. Taste: pretty bitter start, hoppy, somewhat cheesy. Aftertaste: fruity, pineapple, lychee, passion fruit, lots of grapefruit.

(On tap @ Mikkeller & Friends, Copenhagen, May 16 2016) Pours lightly hazed pale amber, with a fine white head that lasts and leaves lace. The aroma is very vinous and grape dominated with white grape flesh and skin, citrus peel, lemon juice, softly funky, fairly subtle. Flavour is also very white grape dominated with flesh and skin, pineapple, citrus pith, woody towards the finish with some musty cellar funk and vanilla. Finish is dry, oaky and grainy bitterness. Medium body, average carbonation and little to no alcohol heat. Feels more prominently white wine-driven than the normal version despite just being a different barrel. Thus it is quite nice but lacks the originals complexity.

Pours cloudy copper with two fingers of white head. Aroma of green grapes and apples, light elderflower, grass, citrus, hints of bretta. Taste is light tart balanced with a fresh sweetness before a mild funky finish. Light and almost creamy body with soft carbonation.
Bottle @ ZZT 2016-1. Golden pour. Aroma of mild tart, white grapes and oak. Flavor has white wine, grapes, smooth tart, soft oaky vanilla and a little yeast. Very elegant brut-ish beer.

Bottle @ ZZT 2016-1, small sample. Thanks all for sharing! Slight hazy golden color, medium frothy head. Aroma of lots of bubblegum and Brett, nelson sauvin, white wine, grapes. Soft sourness in taste, bubblegum sweetness. Lovely balance, great complexity. Loved this one.

750 ml. bottle sampled @ ZZT 2016-1. Dark lightly hazy amber, little off-white head. Nose is big orange peel & bubblegum, thick malty but also with light funk, brett, toffee, vanilla oak mixed funky grapes, noble rot-like grapes, funk, thick toffee. Taste is thick noble rot-like funky grapes, brett with a massive malt base, sugar, bubblegum, vanilla, oak, toffee, orange peel. Thick malty body with low vanilla oak but also brett. Interesting, funk & funky grapes are there, interestingly work well together with the huge malt base, bubblegum & toffee flavours. Interesting, yummy but still quite expensive. This one should evolve interestingly with time & I see it improving a bit as the brett takes a bit more hold of it.

Sampled from bottle @ ZZT 2016-1. Clear a bit rusty orange color, medium sized off-white head that lasts for a decent while. Aroma is quite fruity mixed with some chardonnay. Quite pleasant. Taste lightly malts, chardonnay, brett, lightly fruity, orznges, orangepeel, a hint of peach, vinous. Suitable body and carbonation. Quite pleasant.
Bottle @ ZZT 2016-1. Orange colour with a small whitw head. Smells pretty hoppy, fresh, nice, sweet. Tastes hoppy, sweet, malts. Medium body, soft carbo.

Bottled. Pours hazy deep golden with a small off-white head. Aroma of yeast, funky notes, grapefruit, a little mandarin, wood and green grapes. Slightly sweet flavor that ends up dry and bitter. Medium bodied, oily texture and average carbonation. A very nice Ale indeed. 🌟🌟🌟🌟
Klar bärnstensfärgad öl med lättare skum. Doften är vinös med fruktighet och lättare malt och brettoner. I smaken tillkommer övermogen frukt.

Bottle. Pours golden amber with an off white head. Aroma has lots of green sweet grapes, oak, tannins, plums, dry champagne, caramel and rural notes. The taste is only has a slight tartness and is mostly dominated by oak, citrus, plums and slight cheesy notes. Also lots of vinous notes! Tastes good!

Rating number 1100. Copper colour, very small white head. Aroma of white wine, brett, barnyard, lemon and green apples. Taste is light sweet, slightly tart and sour, it has a long dry bitter finish. Light to medium body, crisp texture, fizzy carbonation. One for the Brett lovers

Draft. An amber beer with a lazing beige head The aroma has notes of wood, alcohol, and over ripe fruits. The flavor is sweet with notes of over ripe fruits, caramel, alcohol and wine, leading to a dry finish
Ámbar limpio y espuma blanca. Aromas de uva, ligero cítrico, menta, brett. Cuerpo medio y sabor cítrico, menta, uva y final seco.

A corked and caged 750ml bottle with no best by or bottled on date (it might have been on the cap but rubbed off) and poured into a Lindemans flute glass. It poured a very nice clear deep copper colour with a one finger off white head that had decent retention and left nice lacing. Aromas of grape, white wine, oak and brett. Taste is similar to the aroma. Grape, white wine, oak, brett, apple cider and a hint of tropical stone fruit. Lightly sweet and sour on the finish. Dry, medium bodied, moderate carbonation and sporadic light warming alcohol. Overall very nice. A top Mikkeller beer and this is right on the fence of a buy beer and a must buy beer.

From tap. Pours clear and golden yellow to orange, small white head. Aroma is mild wineous, malty, fruity. Slight sweet, toasted malt, wineous. A bit more subued than the regular NS. Lingering fruity and smooth wineous finish, mellow finish.

Draught @ Mikkeller Bar, København
Pours clear amber with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt, caramel, white wine, oak, citrus, mango and tropical fruits. Taste is medium sweet and medium bitter with a long white wine, fruity, tropical and citrus finish. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.
Sweet orange aroma. Hazy orange with white head. Bitter orange taste with a light sweet finish. Full bodied with creamy texture & average carbonation.

duft: sød svag rosin lidt appelsin likør
smag: citrus mellem fylde lime appelsin lidt alkohol varm til slut

Bottle @ Mikkeller Bar, Aarhus. Pours slightly hazy golden with an offwhite head. Aroma of malt, light sourness, yeast, brett, fruity hops, nelson, wine grapes, wine, oak. Flavor is light sourness, brett, oak, wine grapes, wine barrels, little vanilla, light alcohol. Medium to full body, average carbonation, light warming alcohol. 160516
Bottle @ Mikkeller Aarhus. Aroma is vinous, brett, some sweetness. Hazy amber with white lasting head. Taste is light+ bitter, brett, dry. Medium body, oily texture, avg. carb., vinous brett finish.
Tap at mikkeller and friends, copenhagen. Clear deep golden color, white head. Aroma has sweet malty notes, wine notes. Nice sweet malty body, white wine notes, some tart notes.
